name: London Life Online Quiz | London | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where did Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother live in London?
questions.explanation:
Clarence House.

	The Queen Mother lived at Clarence House. Kensington Palace and St James Palace have been the London homes of the late Princess Margaret and the Prince of Wales (and other members of the royal family). Lancaster House is not a royal residence although it is next door to Clarence House.

questions.text: What service is provided by the company, 'Arriva'?
questions.explanation:
Buses.

	Arriva is one of the companies running London bus routes under contract. Others are Metroline and Citybus.

questions.text: Where in London is the new 'Big Brother' house?
questions.explanation:
Borehamwood.

	The old Big Brother house was at Bow in East London, on the Bow Back river.

questions.text: Travel writer Paul Theroux lives in London: true or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	False: he used to live in London but now lives in Hawaii.

questions.text: When does the Notting Hill Carnival take place?
questions.explanation:
late August.

	It takes place around the August Bank Holiday weekend towards the end of August each year.

questions.text: What ship is a landmark on the route of the London Marathon?
questions.explanation:
Cutty Sark.

	The Cutty Sark is a landmark on the race, it is a tea clipper sailing ship in dock at Greenwich. HMS Belfast is also in London, moored on the Thames. HMS Victory and the Mary Rose are at Portsmouth. It was badly damaged by fire in May 2007.

questions.text: In London, what are Detour, Fabric, Faith and Infantile?
questions.explanation:
Clubs.

	They are part of London's club scene: Detour is at the ICA, central {London;} Fabric and Faith are in Clerkenwell, {Islington;} Infantile is in Westbourne Park, West London.

questions.text: In what sport are Curlew, Globe and Parr's Priory London-based clubs?
questions.explanation:
Rowing.

	They are among the numerous rowing clubs based along the Thames.

questions.text: What was the tallest building in London in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Canary Wharf.

	Canary Wharf is the tallest, with the NatWest Tower (now renamed as the International Financial Centre) and the Barbican Centre towers both shorter. The Baltic Exchange (destroyed by IRA bombs) is to be the site of a new building, the Swiss Re building, that will be even taller than Canary Wharf. But it hasn't been built yet!

questions.text: In 2008 another terminal was added to London Heathrow Airport. Which number was it?
